# DROP SECRET

`DROP SECRET` removes a secret from Materialize’s secret management
system. If there are connections depending on the secret, you must
explicitly drop them first, or use the `CASCADE` option.

## Syntax

<div class="rr-diagram">

![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)

</div>

| Field | Use |
|----|----|
| **IF EXISTS** | Do not return an error if the specified secret does not exist. |
| *secret_name* | The secret you want to drop. For available secrets, see [`SHOW SECRETS`](../show-secrets). |
| **CASCADE** | Remove the secret and its dependent objects. |
| **RESTRICT** | Do not drop the secret if it has dependencies. *(Default)* |

## Examples

### Dropping a secret with no dependencies

To drop an existing secret, run:

<div class="highlight">

``` chroma
DROP SECRET kafka_sasl_password;
```

</div>

To avoid issuing an error if the specified secret does not exist, use
the `IF EXISTS` option:

<div class="highlight">

``` chroma
DROP SECRET IF EXISTS kafka_sasl_password;
```

</div>

### Dropping a secret with dependencies

If the secret has dependencies, Materialize will throw an error similar
to:

<div class="highlight">

``` chroma
DROP SECRET kafka_sasl_password;
```

</div>

```
ERROR:  cannot drop materialize.public.kafka_sasl_password: still depended upon by catalog
 item 'materialize.public.kafka_connection'
```

, and you’ll have to explicitly ask to also remove any dependent objects
using the `CASCADE` option:

<div class="highlight">

``` chroma
DROP SECRET kafka_sasl_password CASCADE;
```

</div>

## Privileges

The privileges required to execute this statement are:

- Ownership of the dropped secret.
- `USAGE` privileges on the containing schema.

## Related pages

- [`SHOW SECRETS`](../show-secrets)
- [`DROP OWNED`](../drop-owned)

</div>
